bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench's secretary to Henry R. Viets, April 10, 1941

div1.p: Hench's secretary informs Viets that Hench is out of town, therefore he will not be able to submit his yellow fever papers on time.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench's secretary to Henry R. Viets, April 10, 1941
div1.opener:
April 10, 1941
Dr. Henry R. Viets
Bulletin of the Medical Library Association
8 The Fenway
Boston, Massachusetts
Dear Doctor Viets:
div1.p:
In Dr. Hench's temporary absence from the Clinic,
I am acknowledging the receipt of your letter of April 7.
However, Dr. Hench will be away until about May 1, so I
am afraid he will not be able to get the papers on yellow
fever to you by the time you mention. I shall call his
attention to your letter when he returns.
